Key Match Events: Tunisia scored a late goal through Youssef Msakni's penalty in the 87th minute
Malawi's defense was caught napping three times, with Brighton Munthali making three incredible saves to avoid further damage
Post-Match Reflections: The Flames are third in the standings with three points
The visitors are now topping Group H with six points from two games, level with Equatorial Guinea
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Bingu National Stadium
The Tunisians had a height advantage over their opposition
Others: Malawi's head coach Patrick Mabedi suffered his first home defeat
Wisdom Mpinganjira made his debut for the Flames
